column6: Love this Exfoliator, but needs loofa for extra physical exfoliation
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: Love this exfoliator for my body acne and after you shave. This can be used anywhere you have a tendency to get dead skin or acne. It has gentle acids for the body. If you want more physical exfoliation, I recommend using a loofa with it. I suggest that you don't buy the exfoliators products that have beads or salt because they are not safe to use and can damage the natural skin barrier as well as cause more a threat to the marine life in the oceans.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
column14: The only dislike is the price, I might need to stop buying it.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2021

column6: Not sure why it’s called cleanser, it’s exfoliator, so should only be used in specific areas
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I want to say this before anything else, in case all you read is the first part...I don’t know why they called this an “Exfoliating Body Cleanser.” It kind of gives off the wrong idea. A body cleanser is something that I use every day on my whole body. An exfoliator is something I use a couple times a week in specific areas where I feel like I need exfoliation. I don’t feel like exfoliation is needed on my entire body. For me, I don’t think an exfoliator should be used as a body cleanser like soap or a body wash. It should be used in specific areas. But, others might feel differently or like their whole body needs exfoliators. There is more on this throughout the rest of the review, but I just wanted to make sure I put this part at the beginning.
